column1: ( rushing ) Two possible causes for the error here — one, a simple omission, a slip of the pen, perhaps, because the writer paused in the middle of the word.

column1: These texts attributed to Phocylides and to Hecataeus of Miletus are at least two centuries later — with the difference that " Phocylides " covers a forgery, whereas " Hecataeus of Miletus " is a wrong attribution, little more than a slip of the pen.
